crop noun
(PLANT)
Add to word list

B1 [ C ] (the total amount collected of) a plant such as a grain, fruit, or vegetable grown in large amounts: The main crops grown for export are coffee and rice. a bumper (= very good) potato crop
More examplesFewer examplesAfter three crop failures in a row, the people face starvation.He gave a lecture on crop and animal husbandry.This year's harvest was one of the most successful since the record crop of 1985.Wheat is a staple crop for millions of people across the world.Farmers have reported a bumper crop this year.

crop verb
(CUT)
[ T ] to make something shorter or smaller, especially by cutting: He had his hair cropped when he went into the army.
[ T ] When animals such as sheep or horses crop grass or other plants, they eat the top parts.
[ T ] to remove some or all of the edges from a picture, leaving only the most important part: He cropped the photo so that only the face remained.

a plant such as a grain, vegetable, or fruit grown in large amounts on a farm, or the total amount gathered of such a plant: Apple growers celebrated their biggest crop ever last year.
A crop is also any group of similar things or people: We’ve got a new crop of students coming in every year.
